import React from "react"; function CaseMcDs(props) { return (
Roadtrip Playlist Builder
  • Client: McDonald's Canada
  • Timing: 2016
  • Duration: 3 Months
  • Role: Product Owner/Account Director, Spotify
Problem to Solve {"&"} Core Considerations

I needed to come up with a unique and authentic-feeling way to promote the menu option to Canadians on Spotify. The solution needed to tap into the passion points of Canadians in order to deliver on the key insight of pride and local ties. The solution also needed to provide value in order to ensure Canadians would actually engage with the promotion.

Final Solution

Actual imagery of design artifacts and the final website that was “live” during the promotion are no longer available. This diagram gives a high-level view on the core functionality of the final solution, a Roadtrip Playlist Builder website.

Path to Solution

For a promotion of this scale, collaborating cross-functionally became vital to success, objectives {"&"} KPIs across several business units needed to be shared and considered by all involved. Accordingly, at outset, I established an internal team of key stakeholders, to work together to bring the project to life.

Ideation {"&"} Concept Development - Conceived of the initial concept, initiated cross-functional communications to establish a team of stakeholders within Spotify and led the group to determine opportunities for custom content. As a team, we expanded the concept to include Canadian Influencers and fleshed out a comprehensive project idea and structure.

Data-Driven Solution - Insights from Spotify and GoC were employed in every aspect of the project to conceive of, organize and execute our solution. Consumer Marketing utilized listener data and past campaign performance to inform the in-market messaging, and media placement. And, Spotify listener data was employed to select the 10 influential Canadians as well as to direct the themes for all co-branded content. Finally, Spotify listener data was utilized to focus the execution towards a younger adult demo on Spotify.

UX {"&"} Product Ownership - My specific role was firstly, to act as a Product Owner overseeing the design {"&"} development of all co-branded aspects of the partnership, and secondly, to own the relationship with our partner (GoC). More specifically, I crafted the user flow through The Ecosystem, provided direction, feedback and approvals on all custom content and design artifacts, and participated in QA/testing of the Musical History Timeline site prior to launch.

The Backstory
